solution_line_template: The bulk warehouse has {warehouse_cans} cans for ${warehouse_price_dollars} so that's {warehouse_price_dollars}/{warehouse_cans} = ${warehouse_cost_per_can_dollars} a can
The local grocery store has {grocery_cans} cans for ${grocery_price_dollars} so that's {grocery_price_dollars}/{grocery_cans} = ${grocery_cost_per_can_dollars} a can

The grocery store offer is ${grocery_cost_per_can_dollars} a can and the warehouse is ${warehouse_cost_per_can_dollars} a can so the grocery store is {grocery_cost_per_can_dollars}-{warehouse_cost_per_can_dollars} = $<<{grocery_cost_per_can_dollars}-{warehouse_cost_per_can_dollars}={difference_per_can_dollars}>>{difference_per_can_dollars} more expensive per can
